SEARCH
Package UTILITY

Class TrajectoryManager

java.lang.Object
UTILITY.TrajectoryManager
public class TrajectoryManager extends Object
The TrajectoryManager class creates and manages all possible trajectories. Its functionality includes the creation of these possible trajectories and adds them the list of trajectories. This class also provides methods to retrieve the list of atoms created.

      public ArrayList<Trajectory> trajectories

  • Constructor Details

    • TrajectoryManager

      public TrajectoryManager()
      Constructs TrajectoryManager object, initialising an empty list of trajectories and calls the setTrajectories() method to populate the list with predefined trajectories.

  • Method Details

    • setTrajectories

      public void setTrajectories()
      Generates a set of 6 trajectories possible in the hexagonal board and adds it to the list of trajectories. Each trajectory consists of three coordinates representing the movement in the forward, right, and left directions. Note: The implementation uses hard-coded values derived from observations of direction propagation on the board. These trajectories are essential for simulating the movement of rays across the board.

    • getTrajectoriesList

      public ArrayList<Trajectory> getTrajectoriesList()
      This method returns the list of trajectories that are managed by the object. The list contains all the trajectories currently stored in the object.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing all the trajectories.

    • getTrajectory

      public Trajectory getTrajectory(int index)
      This method retrieves the trajectory at the specified index from the list of trajectories.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the trajectory to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The trajectory at the specified index.
